content: AMA SG Budget Babe Bank Account Asked by AnonymousAsked on 14 Aug 2018Are there any saving accounts that allows me to credit my salary via cheque and fulfil the requirement to earn interest?It sounds a little stupid... but my boss credits my salary via a hardcopy cheque instead of GIRO. Would want to earn and build my financial stability as a fresh grad3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent
Jeff Yeo,   amateur Social contributor  at School of social sharingLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Go for the Uob one account no salary credit required 1 comment1
Eric Chia16 Aug 2018Do note you'll need to spend at least $500 on uob credit cards for that month to qualify for bonus interest!

Isabella JoLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 21 Aug 2018Standard chartered super salary account allows Giro crediting (not necessary needs to be salary). Interest rate of 1.2%. Read up more here https://www.sc.com/sg/save/current-accounts/supersalary/0 comments0
Tee-Ming Chew, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 14 Aug 2018I believe you can check out CIMB FastSaver which gives 1% interest without any GIRO requirement.â€‹Hope that helps!0 comments0
